required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Weight Loss in Adults Over 50 With Obesity
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Dietary Protein Intake and Resistance Training on Retention of Fat Free Mass During Weight Loss in Adults Over 50 With Obesity

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to examine the separate and combined effects of a high-protein (HP) diet and resistance training (RT) on body composition and potential biological moderators of body weight in men and women >50y. All participants will receive dietary physical activity guidance through our in-person, group-based weight loss program, State of Slim (SOS). These participants will be randomized to receive either a counseling-based HP diet plan or RT plan. Body composition assessments at 8 wk will identify responders and non-responders; the latter will be re-randomized to "augment" (HP: add protein supplements; RT: supervise RT) or "combine" (HP with protein supplements + supervised RT).

primary_outcome.description: Body fat will be measured via dual energy x-ray absorptiometry [kg]
Fat free mass will be measured via dual energy X-ray absorptiometry [kg]

secondary_outcome.description: Serum glucose will be measured in a fasted state and after a glucose load [mg/dL]
Serum insulin will be measured in a fasted state and after a glucose load [uU/mL]
Fasting serum concentrations of total cholesterol, LDL cholesterol, HDL cholesterol, and triglycerides
Derived from OGTT using 0 minute and 30 minute time-points.
Fat mass and fat-free mass will be measured via dual energy X-ray absorptiometry.
Resting metabolic rate will be assessed for participants while in a fasted state.
Respiratory exchange ratio will be assessed for participants while in a fasted state.
Skeletal muscle mass will be assessed via D3 creatine dilution.

intervention.description: 16 week weight loss program with high protein diet Approximate macronutrient distributions (carbohydrate:protein:fat) will be 32%:40%:28%. Because this protocol uses a sequential, multiple assignment, randomized trial (SMART) design, response will be assessed after 8 weeks. Non-responders will be randomized to either combine the diet with resistance training counseling or add a protein supplement.

16 week weight loss program with normal protein diet and resistance training counseling. Approximate macronutrient distributions (carbohydrate:protein:fat) will be 53%:21%:25%. Because this protocol uses a sequential, multiple assignment, randomized trial (SMART) design, response will be assessed after 8 weeks. Non-responders will be randomized to either combine resistance training with a high-protein diet or add supervised sessions with a personal trainer (2 days per week) to the resistance training regimen.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or Female
- Age â‰¥50 years
- Post-menopausal if Female
- BMI of 30-50 kg/m2 (less than 350 pounds)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Untreated hyper or hypothyroidism.
- Cancer (except basal cell).
- Gastrointestinal disorders affecting food intake.
- <6 months of stable use of medications that affect metabolism, body weight, energy expenditure or appetite.
- Current eating disorder (e.g., binge eating disorder, anorexia, or bulimia).
- Any medical condition for which following a HP diet and/or 70 minutes of exercise daily would be inadvisable.
